title: Tree_Planting_Water_Flow_Flood_Mitigation
name: Strategic Tree Planting for Water Flow Management and Flood Mitigation in Melbourne
description: Comprehensive analysis aligning tree planting schedules with water flow routes to enhance flood mitigation and water retention in Melbourne. This project includes geospatial analysis, environmental benefit simulations, cluster-based prioritization, and actionable recommendations for urban greening and sustainable water management.

datasets.name: Tree Planting Zone Schedules with Years (Urban Forest)
datasets.description: Dataset detailing tree planting schedules and corresponding geographical zones in Melbourne.

datasets.name: Water Flow Routes Over Land (Urban Forest)
datasets.description: Dataset mapping natural water flow paths in urban areas of Melbourne.

key_features: Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Cleaned and standardized tree planting and water flow datasets for consistency and geospatial analysis.
Geospatial Analysis: Mapped water flow routes and identified intersections with tree planting zones using proximity analysis.
Environmental Benefits Simulation: Modeled the 10-year cumulative impact of tree planting on stormwater retention and runoff reduction.
Cluster-Based Recommendations: Prioritized high-impact zones by canopy area, stormwater retention, and runoff reduction metrics.
Interactive Maps: Developed Folium-based maps for visualizing high-priority zones and environmental impacts.
Recommendations: Provided targeted action plans for tree planting efforts to maximize flood mitigation and urban sustainability.
